Description: Fragment of wall of Chian (?) fine-walled black-figured pottery small open vase; white slip; interior worn; remains of two circumscribed rosettes with added dots; exterior: two friezes separated by a line; above, lion with raised paw to left (front part, head lost); incised rosette fill; below, slight remains of dots and circles.
Curator's comments: From same vase as 1924,1201.1152. Plausibly from a phiale judging by the fine make.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.28)
